repo.description: Dockerfiles for (cross-)compiling TokTok projects for various platforms
repo.name: dockerfiles

body: We don't need to download the entire Qt source code. We only use 3 modules: qtbase, qttools, qtsvg. Also, parallelised the 3 main sections of the image build: Qt, non-Qt deps, and gdb. Also, upgraded the Windows Qt version to 6.8.1. This is possible because of our host-qt image, which has the latest Qt built for Linux. - - - This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/dockerfiles/212)

comment_data.body: What is the behavior if we don't specify "-shared"?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,42 +15,80 @@ parse_arch --dep "qt" --supported "win32 win64" "$@"
 
 "$SCRIPT_DIR/download/download_qt.sh"
 
-OPENSSL_LIBS=$(pkg-config --libs openssl)
-export OPENSSL_LIBS
-
 CROSS_COMPILE="$MINGW_ARCH-w64-mingw32-"
 "${CROSS_COMPILE}gcc" --version
 
-./configure -prefix "$DEP_PREFIX" \
+mkdir qtbase/_build && pushd qtbase/_build
+../configure -prefix "$DEP_PREFIX" \
+  -appstore-compliant \
   -release \
-  -shared \

@@ -15,42 +15,80 @@ parse_arch --dep "qt" --supported "win32 win64" "$@"
 
 "$SCRIPT_DIR/download/download_qt.sh"
 
-OPENSSL_LIBS=$(pkg-config --libs openssl)
-export OPENSSL_LIBS
-
 CROSS_COMPILE="$MINGW_ARCH-w64-mingw32-"
 "${CROSS_COMPILE}gcc" --version
 
-./configure -prefix "$DEP_PREFIX" \
+mkdir qtbase/_build && pushd qtbase/_build
+../configure -prefix "$DEP_PREFIX" \
+  -appstore-compliant \
   -release \
-  -shared \
+  -force-asserts \
+  -qt-doubleconversion \
+  -qt-freetype \
+  -qt-harfbuzz \
+  -qt-libjpeg \
+  -qt-libpng \
+  -qt-pcre \
+  -qt-zlib \
+  -feature-zstd \
+  -no-feature-androiddeployqt \
+  -no-feature-brotli \
+  -no-feature-macdeployqt \
+  -no-feature-printsupport \
+  -no-feature-qmake \
+  -no-feature-sql \
+  -no-feature-dbus \
+  -no-opengl \
   -device-option "CROSS_COMPILE=$CROSS_COMPILE" \
-  -qt-host-path /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake \
+  -qt-host-path /work/host/qt \
   -platform linux-g++ \
   -xplatform win32-g++ \
-  -openssl "$(pkg-config --cflags --libs openssl)" \
-  -openssl-linked \

comment_data.body: Added it back. It's the same, but I removed it while testing -static and forgot to put it back.

comment_data.body: With Qt 6.8.1, I was having issues getting the linked version to find the library at runtime. With runtime-resolved libssl, it works. I'll have another look to see if I can get it working.

commit.message:
cleanup: Speed up qtox windows builder image build.

We don't need to download the entire Qt source code. We only use 3
modules: qtbase, qttools, qtsvg. Also, parallelised the 3 main sections
of the image build: Qt, non-Qt deps, and gdb.

Also, upgraded the Windows Qt version to 6.8.1. This is possible because
of our host-qt image, which has the latest Qt built for Linux.

verification.payload:
tree 6cff4176172b3895c3d3369e8e6a4c15c03c4573
parent 565ddea327130a6319a82744c35fba7a8e42cb45
author iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1735172699 +0000
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1735211729 +0000

cleanup: Speed up qtox windows builder image build.

We don't need to download the entire Qt source code. We only use 3
modules: qtbase, qttools, qtsvg. Also, parallelised the 3 main sections
of the image build: Qt, non-Qt deps, and gdb.

Also, upgraded the Windows Qt version to 6.8.1. This is possible because
of our host-qt image, which has the latest Qt built for Linux.

labels.description: Internal code cleanup, possibly affecting semantics, e.g. deleting a deprecated feature.
labels.name: cleanup

title: cleanup: Update qtox windows builder image to Qt 6.8.1.
